instruction: How do I use the UAFX Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier pedal in Live mode to achieve a specific tone, and what are the benefits of using this mode?
output: To use the UAFX Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier pedal in Live mode, press the left footswitch to enter Live mode, and then adjust the knobs and switches to achieve the desired tone. The sound will reflect the current positions of the knobs, switches, and LEDs on the pedal. The benefits of using Live mode include the ability to experiment with different settings in real-time and make adjustments as needed, allowing for a more dynamic and interactive playing experience.

instruction: What is the difference between storing a preset while in Live mode and storing a preset while in Preset mode, and how do these modes affect the saved settings?
output: When storing a preset while in Live mode, the position of all knobs and switches on the pedal are saved, including the ALT knob positions. When storing a preset while in Preset mode, only the knobs and switches that have changed since the preset was loaded are saved. This means that if you make changes to the knobs and switches in Preset mode, the saved preset will reflect those changes, whereas if you store a preset while in Live mode, the saved preset will reflect the current positions of the knobs and switches on the pedal.

instruction: How do I use the UAFX Control mobile app to change the footswitch assignments on my UAFX Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier pedal, and what are the benefits of doing so?
output: To change the footswitch assignments on your UAFX Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier pedal using the UAFX Control mobile app, go to the app's settings menu and select the pedal, then toggle the footswitch assignments as desired. The benefits of changing the footswitch assignments include the ability to customize the pedal to your playing style and preferences, and to access different features and functions more easily.

instruction: What are the advantages and disadvantages of using the UAFX Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier pedal's bypass feature, and how do I use it to add tonal flavor and overdrive sounds to my music?
output: The advantages of using the bypass feature include the ability to add tonal flavor and overdrive sounds to your music, and to create a more dynamic and expressive sound. The disadvantages include the potential for loss of signal quality and the need to adjust the pedal

instruction: When using the Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier, what happens when you set the Bass and Treble knobs to their extreme positions (all the way up or down)?
output: When the Bass and Treble knobs are turned all the way up (to the left), the midrange is reduced and the bass and treble are increased in a very extreme "smiley-face" EQ curve. Conversely, when they are turned all the way down, the midrange is boosted and the bass and treble are reduced. This is because the Bass and Treble knobs work in reverse of most EQ knobs.

instruction: How do you adjust the vibrato speed and intensity on the Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier?
output: To adjust the vibrato speed and intensity, you need to be in ALT mode and use the Bass, Treble, and Boost knobs. The Bass knob controls the vibrato speed, while the Treble knob controls the vibrato intensity. The Boost knob also controls the vibrato intensity in ALT mode.

instruction: What happens when you push the Alt / Amp / Store switch repeatedly in the same direction?
output: When you push the Alt / Amp / Store switch repeatedly in the same direction, the pedal cycles through all available speaker cabinets.

instruction: Can you use the Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier with a real guitar amplifier and speaker cabinet? If so, how do you bypass the speaker cabinet emulation?
output: Yes, you can use the Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier with a real guitar amplifier and speaker cabinet. To bypass the speaker cabinet emulation, press the pedal's Speaker switch until its LED is unlit. This will allow you to use the pedal's amp circuitry with your real guitar amplifier and speaker cabinet.

instruction: What is the primary difference between the Brilliant and Normal channels on the Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier?
output: The primary difference between the Brilliant and Normal channels is the amount of gain and treble provided by the amplifier. The Brilliant channel has more gain and treble due to the addition of an extra tube, whereas the Normal channel has less gain and treble.

instruction: How does the Boost knob function on the Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier, and what are the effects of turning it all the way down to OFF?
output: The Boost knob adds input gain to the amplifier, and turning it all the way down to OFF disables the boost circuitry, which has no effect on the amp's color and gain.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Vibrato circuit on the Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier, and how does it affect the sound?
output: The Vibrato circuit is active on the Vibrato channel and provides a unique sound with its own set of inputs. The Vibrato speed and depth controls are available in ALT mode, and the circuit adds clean gain without added distortion. The Vibrato sound changes depending on the Intensity knob setting, providing harmonic tremolo-type tones at lower settings and more aggressive volume tremolo at higher settings.

instruction: How can you customize the Ruby '63 Top Boost Amplifier's footswitch modes using the UAFX Control app?
output: You can customize the footswitch modes using the UAFX Control app by opening the Settings screen, tapping the current footswitch mode, and choosing a mode from the drop-down menu. This allows you to toggle live mode and preset mode, switch between the amp's preamp and the pedal's preamp in 4-cable mode, and toggle boost and vibrato features in almost any combination.

instruction: What are the two conditions that must be met for this device to operate legally in Canada, according to the provided text?
output: According to the text, the two conditions are: (1) the device must not cause interference, and (2) the device must accept any interference, including interference that may cause undesired operation of the device.

instruction: How do the regulations regarding the disposal of used electrical and electronic equipment relate to the operation of this device?
output: According to the text, used electrical and electronic equipment should not be mixed with general household waste. Instead, it should be disposed of in accordance with local regulations. This is a separate requirement from the operation of the device itself, but it is important for environmental sustainability.

instruction: What is the significance of the IEC 62368-1 standard and the FCC ID: 2AXKQ2029 and IC ID: 26610-2029 labels in relation to this device?
output: The IEC 62368-1 standard is a safety standard for electrical and electronic equipment, and the FCC ID and IC ID labels indicate that the device complies with Industry Canada's license-exempt RSS standard(s). This means that the device has been tested and meets certain safety and regulatory requirements for use in Canada.

instruction: What is the purpose of the EU declaration of conformity, and where can it be found?
output: The EU declaration of conformity is a document that declares the device's compliance with the EU's Radio Equipment Directive (2014/53/EU). It can be found at the internet address provided in the text, Signed EU Declaration of Conformity.pdf.
